intro: Fritillaria polyphylla, commonly known as the Persian fritillary, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces several leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and conservation status, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
